availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Palmer Satterwhite (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician. Lexington, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas P. Satterwhite and Mary Calwell Breckinridge Satterwhite. Married to Maria Preston Pope Rogers Satterwhite in Louisville, Kentucky, on January 14, 1858. Father of Lilly R. Satterwhite and Thomas P. Satterwhite Jr. Graduate of Medical College of Louisville in Louisville in 1857. Student in Fayette County in 1850. Physician in Louisville in 1860. Employed Margaret Smith as a domestic servant in Louisville in 1860. Employed one enslaved person owned by William Ronalds in Louisville in 1860. Demonstrator of Anatomy of the Medical Department of Louisville in 1864.
